1.text: Paul, sent, (not from men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, having raised him from the dead;)

2.text: And with me all the brethren, to the churches of Galatia:

3.text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: Having given himself for our sins, that he might take us away out of this present evil time, according to the will of God and our Father:

5.text: To whom the glory for the time of times. Amen.

6.text: I wonder that so quickly are ye transferred from him having called you by the grace of Christ to another good news:

7.text: Which is not another; except some are troubling you, and wishing to pervert the good news of Christ.

8.text: But also if we, or a messenger from heaven, announce good news to you, more than what: we have announced to you, let him be anathema.

9.text: As we said before, also now say I again, If any announce to you good news above what ye received, let him be anathema.

10.text: For now do I persuade men, or God? or seek I to please men? for if I had yet pleased men, I should not have been the servant of Christ.

11.text: But I make known to you, brethren, the good news announced by me that it is not according to man.

12.text: For I neither received it from man, neither was I taught, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

13.text: For ye heard of my turning about when in Judaism, that in excess I drove out the church of God, and laid it waste:

14.text: And I advanced in Judaism above many like in my race, being more abundantly zealous of paternal traditions.

15.text: And when God was contented, having separated me from my mother’s womb, and having called me, by his grace,

16.text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might announce him the good news in the nations; I consulted not with flesh and blood:

17.text: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them sent before me; but I went away to Arabia, and again returned to Damascus.

18.text: Then after three years I came up to Jerusalem to examine Peter, and remained with him fifteen days.

19.text: And other of the sect I saw not, except James the Lord’s brother.

20.text: And what I write to you, behold, before God, that I lie not.

21.text: Then came I to the regions of Syria and Cilicia;

22.text: And was unknown by face to the churches of Judea there in Christ.

23.text: And only they had heard, That he then driving us out, now announces the good news, the faith which he then felt the absence of.

24.text: And they glorified God in me.
